page.title: 07Swiss Gardens
page.content: A major tourist attraction at Old Warden is the Swiss Garden.It was built in 1832 and completed by 1834 by Lord Ongley.In 1796 before becoming a multi_millionaire,he was a train builder.He later bought 9 acres of land.Lord Ongley was born on 3rd October 1771 and owned what is now the Shuttleworth estates. The legend is that Lord Ongley had a Swiss girlfriend, and he built the garden for her which included a Swiss cottage.Another legend is that Lord Ongley's Swiss girlfriend had a son who died of pneumonia aged 9.Lord Ongley was so shocked that he built a marble slab under an oak tree which included a marble book that had a poem written in it.The boy is buried nearby where a cross marks his grave.The Swiss Garden is now open to visitors with 750_800 people each week.
